data.question: You’ve received your first job offer, but the commute is two hours each way. What do you do?

options.text: Accept the offer and endure the commute for experience.
Politely decline and look for a closer opportunity.
Ask your employer for flexible work hours.

data.question: Your manager gives you an urgent project due tomorrow. What’s your move?

options.text: Stay late and finish it, even if it ruins your evening.
Request an extension to deliver higher quality.
Delegate parts of it to your team.

data.question: It’s time for your first performance review. How do you prepare?

options.text: Build a presentation showcasing your achievements.
Keep it casual and trust your manager knows your worth.
Ask colleagues for feedback to strengthen your case.

data.question: Your team’s project deadline is at risk due to poor planning. What do you do?

options.text: Take charge and pull a few all-nighters to meet the deadline.
Communicate the risks to the client and request an extension.
Redistribute the workload and focus on key deliverables.

data.question: Your company is hosting a weekend team-building retreat. Do you attend?

options.text: Go enthusiastically to network and bond with colleagues.
Skip it for some much-needed personal time.
Attend only the key sessions to show your presence.

data.question: A promotion opportunity arises, but it requires frequent travel. What’s your choice?

options.text: Accept the role, excited about new challenges.
Decline and wait for a better-suited promotion.
Negotiate for limited travel to balance work-life.

data.question: Your boss offers you a chance to lead a high-stakes project. How do you react?

options.text: Take the opportunity and work overtime to succeed.

Offer to co-lead with a colleague to share the load.

data.question: Your team is underperforming. How do you address it?

data.question: You receive a job offer with a higher salary but in a different city. What’s your decision?

options.text: Move to the new city for the opportunity.

Accept the offer and negotiate for remote work.

data.question: A workplace conflict arises with a colleague. What’s your approach?

Try to resolve it calmly over coffee.

Politely decline due to lack of time.
